meanings.definition: Make someone deaf or partially deaf.
meanings.sent1: The loud explosion bedeafened the poor dog.
meanings.sent2: The construction work next door bedeafened the entire neighborhood.
meanings.sent3: The sudden burst of music bedeafened the sleepy cat, making it jump in surprise.
meanings.sent4: The continuous honking of car horns bedeafened her ears, drowning out all other sounds.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's shouting bedeafened the students, causing them to cover their ears in pain.

meanings.definition: To become deaf or partially deaf.
meanings.sent1: After years of exposure to loud noises, he slowly bedeafened.
meanings.sent2: As she grew older, her hearing gradually bedeafened.
meanings.sent3: The old radio's volume knob seemed to be bedeafening itself, turning up on its own.
meanings.sent4: The silence in the room bedeafened her, making her feel isolated and alone.
meanings.sent5: The constant ringing in his ears bedeafened him to the world around him.
